p: Our study showed that the estimated rate of COVID-19 severity in patients was 22.76%, which was lower than that of the previous study [ 11]. This is possibly attributed to the single-center design of this study, and we collected the previously healthy young part of patients, causing possible bias in patient distribution. Moreover, based on the results of our study, the sex difference was not associated with the development of severe COVID-19, a result consistent with the previous study [ 11].
